perturbation.original_text: Racing shall also provide comprehensive (fire and theft) and collision insurance on each vehicle used in the Business. Racing shall provide the Sponsor a certificate of insurance evidencing "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" as additional insureds, stating that such insurance is primary in coverage to any other insurance which may be available the Sponsor, and providing at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice to the Sponsor of cancellation, modification or material change to the policy.
perturbation.changed_text: Racing shall also provide comprehensive (fire and theft) and collision insurance on each vehicle used in the Business. Racing shall provide the Sponsor a certificate of insurance evidencing "Gainsco Inc. and all related entities" as additional insureds, stating that such insurance is primary in coverage to any other insurance which may be available to the Sponsor, and providing at least ten (10) days' prior written notice to the Sponsor of cancellation, modification or material change to the policy.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'thirty (30) days' to 'ten (10) days' prior written notice of cancellation, modification, or material change to the insurance policy creates a legal contradiction. In Texas, insurance policies typically require a minimum of 30 days' notice for cancellation or significant changes, especially for commercial policies. Reducing this to 10 days violates standard insurance practices and could be deemed insufficient notice under Texas law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code - General insurance regulations typically require at least 30 days' notice for cancellation or material changes to insurance policies.

perturbation.original_text: Racing, within fifteen (15) days after receipt of written notice by the Sponsor terminates the employment of, or otherwise dismisses from the racing team,  the driver(s), general manager(s) or other member(s) of Racing engaging in the offensive conduct.
perturbation.changed_text: Racing, within five (5) days after receipt of written notice by the Sponsor terminates the employment of, or otherwise dismisses from the racing team,  the driver(s), general manager(s) or other member(s) of Racing engaging in the offensive conduct.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time frame from 15 to 5 days for Racing to terminate an employee after receiving notice of offensive conduct introduces a legal contradiction. This shorter timeframe may not allow Racing to conduct a proper investigation or follow legally required termination procedures under Texas employment law, potentially leading to wrongful termination claims. Texas law typically requires employers to provide reasonable time for investigation and due process before termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Labor Code - Employment termination laws, which require reasonable time for investigation and due process.
